metadata.title: CVE-2020-26145 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered on Samsung Galaxy S3 i9305 4.4.4 devices. The WEP,WPA, WPA2, and WPA3 implementations accept second (or subsequent) broadcastfragments even when sent in plaintext and process them as full unfragmentedframes. An adversary can abuse this to inject arbitrary network packetsindependent of the network configuration.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26145` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
